sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A buckler against adversitie, or, A treatise of constancie written in French by the Right Honourable the Lord Du Vair ... ; and now done into English by Andreuu Court. De la constance et consolation és calamites publiques. English. 1622 Du Vair, Guillaume, 1556-1621. Court, Andrew.
[6], 165 p.
Printed by Bernard Alsop, dwelling in Distaffe Lane at the signe of the Dolphin, London : 1622.
Translation of "De la constance et consolation és calamites publiques".--Cf. NUC pre-1956 imprints. "Orpheus, or, The second booke of constancie" and "Linus, or, The third booke of constancie" each has a separate t.p. Signatures: A³ B-X⁴ Y³. Errata: p. [4]. Imperfect: stained with slight loss of print. Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[6], 165 p.
Printed by Bernard Alsop, dwelling in Distaffe Lane at the signe of the Dolphin, London : 1622.
Translation of "De la constance et consolation és calamites publiques".--Cf. NUC pre-1956 imprints. "Orpheus, or, The second booke of constancie" and "Linus, or, The third booke of constancie" each has a separate t.p. Signatures: A³ B-X⁴ Y³. Errata: p. [4]. Imperfect: stained with slight loss of print. Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Bernard Alsop
Distaffe Lane at the signe of the Dolphin
